intro: Lasiosiphon sisparensis, commonly known as the New Zealand morning glory, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces violet to blue flowers that open in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth.
